summary: SPEEDOMETER CABLE WAS FOUND CHAFFING AGAINST THE FRONT BRAKE ROTOR. THE RESULT CAUSED A SHORT ELECTRICAL SYSTEM FOR THE SPEED. MOTORCYCLE WOULD GIVE INACCURATE READING (150 MPH, WHEN DOING 30.) SPEEDOMETER CABLE NEEDS TO BE THICKER AND SECURED AWAY FROM THE FRONT ROTOR, OR HAVE A SHIELD AROUND IT TO COMPLETELY PREVENT IT FROM RUBBING AGAINST THE ROTOR.
